    • Method Detail

      • init

        public static void init(Connections c)
        Uses the specified Connections object to Build the structural anatomy needed by this TemporalMemory to implement its algorithms. The connections object holds the Column and Cell infrastructure, and is used by both the SpatialPooler and TemporalMemory. Either of these can be used separately, and therefore this Connections object may have its Columns and Cells initialized by either the init method of the SpatialPooler or the init method of the TemporalMemory. We check for this so that complete initialization of both Columns and Cells occurs, without either being redundant (initialized more than once). However, Cells only get created when initializing a TemporalMemory, because they are not used by the SpatialPooler.
        Parameters:
        c - Connections object

      • compute

        public ComputeCycle compute(Connections conn,
                            int[] activeColumnIndices,
                            boolean learn)
        Feeds input record through TM, performing inference and learning. Updates : - activeCells - winnerCells - activeSegments - matchingSegments 
          Pseudocode:
  for each column
    if column is active and has active distal dendrite segments
      call activatePredictedColumn
    if column is active and doesn't have active distal dendrite segments
      call burstColumn
    if column is inactive and has matching distal dendrite segments
      call punishPredictedColumn
  for each distal dendrite segment with activity >= activationThreshold
    mark the segment as active
  for each distal dendrite segment with unconnected activity >= minThreshold
    mark the segment as matching
        Specified by:
        compute in interface ComputeDecorator
        Parameters:
        conn - The column/cell structure and connectivity
        activeColumnIndices - Indexes of Columns active during the current cycle
        learn - Whether or not learning is enabled
        Returns:
        ComputeCycle container for one cycle of inference values.

      • reset

        public void reset(Connections connections)
        Indicates the start of a new sequence and resets the sequence state of the TM.
        Specified by:
        reset in interface ComputeDecorator
        Parameters:
        connections - The Connections object containing the state

      • activatePredictedColumn

        public java.util.List<Cell> activatePredictedColumn(Connections conn,
                                                    java.util.List<Connections.SegmentOverlap> activeSegments,
                                                    java.util.Set<Cell> prevActiveCells,
                                                    double permanenceIncrement,
                                                    double permanenceDecrement,
                                                    boolean learn)

        Determines which cells in a predicted column should be added to winner cells list and calls adaptSegment on the segments that correctly predicted this column.

        Pseudocode: 

         for each cell in the column that has an active distal dendrite segment
     mark the cell as active
     mark the cell as a winner cell
     (learning) for each active distal dendrite segment
         strengthen active synapses
         weaken inactive synapses

        Parameters:
        conn - Connections instance for the tm
        activeSegments - A Iterable of SegmentOverlap objects for the column compute is operating on that are active
        prevActiveCells - Active cells in `t-1`
        permanenceIncrement - Amount by which permanences of synapses are incremented during learning.
        permanenceDecrement - Amount by which permanences of synapses are decremented during learning.
        learn - Determines if permanences are adjusted
        Returns:
        A list of predicted cells that will be added to active cells and winner cells.

      • burstColumn

        public Tuple burstColumn(Connections conn,
                         Column column,
                         java.util.List<Connections.SegmentOverlap> matchingSegments,
                         java.util.Set<Cell> prevActiveCells,
                         java.util.Set<Cell> prevWinnerCells,
                         double permanenceIncrement,
                         double permanenceDecrement,
                         java.util.Random random,
                         boolean learn)
        Activates all of the cells in an unpredicted active column, chooses a winner cell, and, if learning is turned on, either adapts or creates a segment. growSynapses is invoked on this segment.

        Pseudocode: 

          mark all cells as active
  if there are any matching distal dendrite segments
      find the most active matching segment
      mark its cell as a winner cell
      (learning)
      grow and reinforce synapses to previous winner cells
  else
      find the cell with the least segments, mark it as a winner cell
      (learning)
      (optimization) if there are previous winner cells
          add a segment to this winner cell
          grow synapses to previous winner cells

        Parameters:
        conn - Connections instance for the TM
        column - Bursting Column
        prevActiveCells - Active cells in `t-1`
        prevWinnerCells - Winner cells in `t-1`
        initialPermanence - Initial permanence of a new synapse.
        maxNewSynapseCount - The maximum number of synapses added to a segment during learning
        permanenceIncrement - Amount by which permanences of synapses are decremented during learning
        permanenceDecrement - Amount by which permanences of synapses are incremented during learning
        random - Random number generator
        learn - Whether or not learning is enabled
        Returns:
        Tuple containing: cells list of the processed column's cells bestCell the best cell

      • punishPredictedColumn

        public void punishPredictedColumn(Connections conn,
                                  java.util.List<Connections.SegmentOverlap> matchingSegments,
                                  java.util.Set<Cell> prevActiveCells,
                                  double predictedSegmentDecrement)
        Punishes the Segments that incorrectly predicted a column to be active. 

         Pseudocode:
  for each matching segment in the column
    weaken active synapses

        Parameters:
        conn - Connections instance for the tm
        matchingSegments - An iterable of SegmentOverlap objects for the column compute is operating on that are matching; None if empty
        prevActiveCells - Active cells in `t-1`
        predictedSegmentDecrement - Amount by which permanences of synapses are decremented during learning.

      • leastUsedCell

        public Cell leastUsedCell(Connections conn,
                          java.util.List<Cell> cells,
                          java.util.Random random)
        Gets the cell with the smallest number of segments. Break ties randomly.
        Parameters:
        conn - Connections instance for the tm
        cells - List of Cells
        random - Random Number Generator
        Returns:
        the least used Cell

      • growSynapses

        public void growSynapses(Connections conn,
                         java.util.Set<Cell> prevWinnerCells,
                         DistalDendrite segment,
                         double initialPermanence,
                         int nDesiredNewSynapses,
                         java.util.Random random)
        Creates nDesiredNewSynapes synapses on the segment passed in if possible, choosing random cells from the previous winner cells that are not already on the segment.

        Notes: The process of writing the last value into the index in the array that was most recently changed is to ensure the same results that we get in the c++ implementation using iter_swap with vectors.

        Parameters:
        conn - Connections instance for the tm
        prevWinnerCells - Winner cells in `t-1`
        segment - Segment to grow synapses on.
        initialPermanence - Initial permanence of a new synapse.
        nDesiredNewSynapses - Desired number of synapses to grow
        random - Tm object used to generate random numbers

      • adaptSegment

        public void adaptSegment(Connections conn,
                         DistalDendrite segment,
                         java.util.Set<Cell> prevActiveCells,
                         double permanenceIncrement,
                         double permanenceDecrement)
        Updates synapses on segment. Strengthens active synapses; weakens inactive synapses.
        Parameters:
        conn - Connections instance for the tm
        segment - DistalDendrite to adapt
        prevActiveCells - Active Cells in `t-1`
        permanenceIncrement - Amount to increment active synapses
        permanenceDecrement - Amount to decrement inactive synapses
